result.execSummary:
The defendant Larrell J Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:

No illegally controlled substances.
AODA, programs or treatment.  Random screening.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the mandatory surcharge.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes sectin 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession, voting.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Larrell J Williams in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel, Tammy R. and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample, pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 3:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 2 years with 8 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 1 year  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 1 year; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) AODA, programs or treatment; 4) no illegally controlled substances; 5) random screening.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the madatory surcharge;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.

Defense asks to have the property returned that was seized.  State advises that it was to be released at the conclusion of the codefendant's trial.  State will again request that the property is to be released.  

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Larrell J Williams in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Parties move to adjourn the sentencing pending the codefendant's jury trial.  Court grants the motion on adjourn the sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Joint Notice of Motion and Motion to Adjourn Sentencing Hearing to Permit Compliance with Testimonial Cooperation Agreement received and filed./ds

Defendant Larrell J Williams in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Plea Negotiation placed on the record.  
Defendant sworn in. 
AS TO COUNT  1 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting.
Parties request a sentencing hearing following the co-defendant's trial date.  
Parties are advised as of August 1, 2014 this matter will be reassigned to Judge Konkol, Br 44 in room 506 of the safety building.  
Case adjourned to Branch 44.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-25-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Larrell J Williams in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
BRANCH 25 FOR BRANCH 12. Case set for plea hearing. Defense counsel requests an adjourned plea date to further review the offer with the defendant. State does not object. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 12.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Paul A Oberer in court with defendant Larrell J Williams.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Defense has received discovery.  Parties are working on a resolution to this matter and defense request a plea hearing.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Plea hearing scheduled for 07-16-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Larrell J Williams in court with attorney Paul A Oberer.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski presiding.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Oral No Weapons Order  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-29-2014 at 08:30 am.

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.
